name: Bengaluru
description: The Silicon Valley of India, a bustling metropolis with a vibrant culture and pleasant climate.

name: Jaipur
description: The Pink City, famous for its stunning forts, palaces, and rich Rajput history.

name: Jodhpur
description: The Blue City, dominated by the majestic Mehrangarh Fort.

name: Udaipur
description: The City of Lakes, known for its romantic palaces and beautiful lakes.

name: Jaisalmer
description: The Golden City, rising from the Thar Desert with its magnificent fort.

name: Goa
description: India's beach paradise, known for its lively nightlife, golden sands, and Portuguese heritage.

name: North Goa
description: The vibrant and energetic part of Goa, famous for parties and markets.

name: South Goa
description: The serene and peaceful part of Goa, known for luxury resorts and pristine beaches.

name: Mumbai
description: The city of dreams, a financial powerhouse and the heart of the Bollywood film industry.

name: Agra
description: Home to the iconic Taj Mahal, a city steeped in Mughal history.

name: Varanasi
description: The spiritual capital of India, with its sacred ghats along the river Ganges.

name: Lucknow
description: The city of Nawabs, known for its politeness, beautiful gardens, and Mughal cuisine.

name: Prayagraj
description: A holy city known for the Triveni Sangam, the confluence of three sacred rivers.

name: Mathura
description: The birthplace of Lord Krishna, a major pilgrimage site for Hindus.

name: Shimla
description: The Queen of Hills, a charming colonial hill station with stunning Himalayan views.

name: Manali
description: A popular destination for adventure sports, surrounded by snow-capped peaks.

name: Dharamshala
description: Home to the Dalai Lama, a spiritual center with a blend of Tibetan and Kangra culture.

name: Dalhousie
description: A quiet hill station with colonial-era architecture and panoramic views of the Dhauladhar range.

name: Rishikesh
description: The 'Yoga Capital of the World', a spiritual town on the banks of the Ganges.

name: Nainital
description: A charming hill station known for its emerald-colored Naini Lake and colonial architecture.

name: Mussoorie
description: The 'Queen of the Hills', offering stunning views of the Himalayas and lush green valleys.

name: Dehradun
description: The capital of Uttarakhand, nestled in the Doon Valley, known for its pleasant climate and prestigious schools.

name: Srinagar
description: The summer capital of Jammu and Kashmir, famous for Dal Lake, houseboats, and Mughal gardens.

name: Gulmarg
description: A popular skiing destination and home to the world's highest gondola.

name: Pahalgam
description: Known as the 'Valley of Shepherds', famous for its pristine rivers and lush meadows.

name: Gangtok
description: The capital of Sikkim, a vibrant hill station with a blend of tradition and modernity.

name: Pelling
description: A small town in West Sikkim, famous for its magnificent views of the Kanchenjunga.

name: Lachung
description: A scenic mountain village close to the Tibetan border, known for the Yumthang Valley.

name: Namchi
description: The cultural capital of Sikkim, known for its large statues and religious sites.

name: Kolkata
description: The cultural capital of India, known for its colonial architecture, art galleries and festivals.

name: Darjeeling
description: Famous for its tea plantations, Himalayan railway, and stunning views of Kanchenjunga.

name: Siliguri
description: A bustling city at the foothills of the Himalayas, serving as a gateway to Darjeeling, Sikkim, and Northeast India.

name: Kalimpong
description: A serene hill station known for its colonial architecture, Buddhist monasteries, and panoramic valley views.

name: Chennai
description: The vibrant capital of Tamil Nadu, known for its beaches, temples, and rich cultural heritage.

name: Madurai
description: An ancient city famed for its Meenakshi Amman Temple and rich Tamil culture.

name: Kanyakumari
description: The southernmost tip of mainland India, famous for its spectacular sunrises and sunsets.

name: Ooty
description: The 'Queen of Hill Stations', known for its rolling hills, tea gardens, and colonial charm.

name: Kodaikanal
description: The 'Princess of Hill Stations', famous for its star-shaped lake, forests, and pleasant climate.
